metadata.title: CVE-2020-25647 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. During USB deviceinitialization, descriptors are read with very little bounds checking andassumes the USB device is providing sane values. If properly exploited, anattacker could trigger memory corruption leading to arbitrary codeexecution allowing a bypass of the Secure Boot mechanism. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity aswell as system availability.

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
